ln: The natural logarithm <tt>ln(n)</tt> is the amount of time needed to reach a certain level of continuous growth, where n is the level reached. So if we want to find out how many time units we need to get 20 growth we would use <tt>ln(20)</tt> which returns 2.99 units of time to get that amount of growth.
The above code uses the natural logarithm of the value stored in the variable "age" to set an alarm.
